activities:
Sonian receives personal information in the form of business email addresses, business phone numbers and business addresses when selling and supporting our service in the EU/EEA and Switzerland.  This information is recorded within our application for user validation and access control. 

The Sonian service is subscribed to by organizations (corporations, non-profits, government, institutions, etc) to help them comply with their internal and/or external record retention policies.  The customer configures their email service to journal copies of all or some of their emails to the Sonian service where they are encrypted and made available for search to the customers designated / authorized users.  Those customers who subscribe to the Sonian service from the EU / EEA and Switzerland automatically have their archive data stored exclusively in an EU data center.  This archive data does not leave the EU data centers.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Our self-certification covers the both the individual data we collect about our customers (email address, first name, last name, phone #), as well as, the organizational emails journaled to us as part of a subscription service.
privacyprograms: Sonian self-regulates its own privacy program.
recoursemech: Sonian designates JAMS for dispute resolution.
